pubinfo.publish: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development, National Center for Environmental Assessment

citeinfo.title: Changes in Absolute Sea Level Along U.S. Coasts

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness, and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of EPA would be appreciated.

descript.purpose: These data were created to be used for the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Report on the Environment website.
descript.abstract: This map shows changes in absolute sea level from 1960 to 2020 based on satellite measurements. Data were adjusted by applying an inverted barometer (air pressure) correction.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development, National Center for Environmental Assessment

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness.

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at http://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

procstep.procdesc: EPA's contractor team processed the data from a netCDF to a raster. Data were projected into Web Mercator (auxiliary sphere) for use in web maps for the ROE website.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development, National Center for Environmental Assessment

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development, National Center for Environmental Assessment

attr.attrdef: Changes in absolute sea level along U.S. coasts in units of inches per decade.
